metadata.Title: CVE-2021-3483 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A flaw was found in the Nosy driver in the Linux kernel. This issue allows a device to be inserted twice into a doubly-linked list, leading to a use-after-free when one of these devices is removed. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to confidentiality, integrity, as well as system availability. Versions before kernel 5.12-rc6 are affected 马哲宇 discovered that the IEEE 1394 (Firewire) nosy packet sniffer driver in the Linux kernel did not properly perform reference counting in some situations, leading to a use-after-free vulnerability. A local attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (system crash) or possibly execute arbitrary code.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-3483` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-219-generic - 4.4.0-219.252
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-219-generic - 4.4.0-219.252
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-219-lowlatency - 4.4.0-219.252
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1135-aws - 4.4.0-1135.149
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-1103-aws - 4.15.0-1103.110~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-219.252').

linux-aws-hwe package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1103.110~16.04.1').

linux-gcp package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1100.113~16.04.1').
linux-gke: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
